column5: ive been wondering if it is legal to use more than one jig(or set of hooks)on a line at one time? also more than one rod per person? any info on this is much appreciated thank you in advance.

You'll have to be more specific, sir. Each province has its own regulations and each province is broken into Divisions which have further regulations. You may find the answer to your query if you are looking at Ontario at the following link.http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/fishing/gen.html
ill be fishing in manitoba on the winnipeg and red rivers

In Manitoba 1 rod per person during open water. 2 hooks per line. A common rig here is the pickerel rig, with 2 hooks above a weight. I tie a hook onto a line with a palomar knot and a jig at the bottom.
ty for the info, i was just courious cause i have a rig that works well for ice fishing, it also works well for eyes and perch here.
